chapters.title: Ravens
chapters.info: Berowyn al'Vere, p. [3]—Oldest of the five daughters of Bran and Marin al'Vere; Egwene's oldest sister. She has been allowed to wear her hair in a braid, the Two Rivers symbol of adulthood for women, since she was sixteen years old. Berowyn was married, but her husband and her newborn child died in the epidemic of breakbone fever that struck the village; the same epidemic threatened Egwene's life as well. She has since treated Egwene as though she were Berowyn's own child, mooning over her as if she were the last thing left in her life. See also al'Vere, Alene; al'Vere, Brandelwyn; al'Vere, Egwene; al'Vere, Elisa; al'Vere, Loise; al'Vere, Marin.
